Html:
Hi All,

I downloaded the OOpFactory X12 Parser, and it's a great program for generating XML from our 835 files.  I've been tasked with creating an xslt to transform the xml to look something like our old paper statements for archival in our document imaging system.  The problem is I've never dealt with XSLT before and writing a transform of this complexity from scratch seems like a fairly daunting task.

Has anyone had any experience creating XLSTs for 835s or know of a resource where I may find and/or purchase a pre-built template?  I've searched everywhere I can think and have come up empty.

Thanks!

I have not done this for the 835, but I have done this for the 837 into the standardized claim forms.  That is part of the OopFactory.X12.Hipaa.dll assembly and the ClaimParser.exe.

Did you want the final format to be pdf or tiff?

If you post a blank form of the paper statement I can get you started with a documentation page on how to do this.
